notes: Memory leak reproduction requires Windows OS with Nvidia Quadro GPU and high-resolution monitor. The issue is specific to WPF's D3D compositor interaction with Quadro drivers and cannot be reproduced on macOS. Triage analysis correctly identified this as a WPF framework issue (dotnet/wpf#10005) triggered by SkiaSharp's rendering workload, not a SkiaSharp code bug. Code verification confirms: (1) SKElement implementation matches triage findings - creates WriteableBitmap, passes to WPF compositor which leaks on Quadro drivers; (2) SKGLElement disposal bug (#3309) remains unfixed in main branch - PR #3311 is still open as of 2026-02-12. If reporter uses SKGLElement, that PR would fix the OpenTK disposal leak, but not the broader WPF+Quadro compositor issue.

reproductionSteps.description: Verify environment constraints - check if Windows with Nvidia Quadro GPU is available
Verify SKElement.cs implementation matches triage findings about WriteableBitmap compositor leak path
Check SKGLElement.cs disposal implementation and verify if PR #3311 has been merged
Verify related issues and external references cited in triage

versionResults.notes: Cannot test memory leak behavior on macOS - requires Windows with WPF and Nvidia Quadro GPU. Reporter claims this version worked without leaks.
Cannot test memory leak behavior on macOS - requires Windows with WPF and Nvidia Quadro GPU. Reporter observes unbounded memory growth with this version.

Cannot test memory leak behavior on macOS. Code verification shows: (1) SKElement WriteableBitmap path unchanged - still vulnerable to WPF compositor leak on affected drivers; (2) SKGLElement disposal bug (#3309) remains unfixed - PR #3311 not yet merged.

blockers: Reproduction requires Windows operating system with WPF framework support
Reproduction requires Nvidia Quadro series GPU with specific driver behavior - leak does not occur on Nvidia GeForce or AMD GPUs
Reproduction requires high-resolution monitor with DPI scaling to trigger WPF compositor memory leak under GPU texture churn
